title_en: 97% of LCBO workers voted for strike action
summary_en:
97% of LCBO employees voted for a strike.
The Ontario Public Service Workers Union reported more than 8,000 members voting.
Negotiations on a new contract have been ongoing since March, and the main stumbling block is job security guarantees.
Premier Doug Ford has announced plans to allow alcohol sales in convenience stores and grocery stores by 2026.
LCBO remains the only place where strong alcoholic beverages can be purchased, and remains a wholesaler.
The government has no plans to privatize LCBO.

title_en: Gallery: This is how the Swiss demonstration took place
summary_en:
A demonstration demanding the freedom of trade union activists convicted of labor conflict in the 19th century took place in Switzerland.
The author of the article expresses concern about the attitude of the local government towards fountain merchants.
The trade union association for the Protection of Convicted Swiss Women has also attracted attention.
The article contains photos and headlines related to the events in Switzerland on June 16, 2024.

title: Fecode –æ–±—ä—è–≤–∏–ª –æ –≤–∑—è—Ç–∏–∏ –ë–æ–≥–æ—Ç—ã –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω–∏–∫, 17 –∏—é–Ω—è: —ç—Ç–æ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –º–µ—Å—Ç–∞ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏
title_en: Fecode announced the capture of Bogota on Monday, June 17th: These will be the meeting places
summary_en:
The Colombian Federation of Education Workers confirmed the locations of the rally on June 17.
The rally is called the "Great Capture of Bogota" because of the discussion of the draft they want to withdraw at the Senate plenary session.
Fecode announced the capture of Bogota on Monday, June 17th, for a meeting.
The Ministry of Education continues to protest against the education bill being considered in Congress.
Air-e is charging prices for investments it did not make, prompting an investigation by the Public Utilities Administration.
A group of male weavers became popular after demonstrating their talent in the Medellin metro.
Under the slogan "Knitting is a matter for people", the team of seamstresses at the Medellin house and metro intends to abandon masculinity.
Some suggest that the "retirement" of a patrolman reported missing is a response to the process of finding peace of mind.
